Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class ArrayMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.ArrayMethods
  • public class ArrayMethods
extends Object
    Methods for working with arrays.

                             T obj)
        Appends the provided object to the provided array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to append the object to
        obj - The object to append
        Returns:
        A concatenation of array and obj

      • append

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> T[] append​(T[] array,
                             T obj1,
                             T obj2,
                             T... moreObjs)
        Appends the provided objects to the provided array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to append the objects to
        obj1 - The 1st object to append
        obj2 - The 2nd object to append
        moreObjs - More objects to append
        Returns:
        A concatenation of array, obj1, obj2 and moreObjs

      • concat

                             T[] array2)

        Type Parameters:
        T - The element type of the arrays
        Parameters:
        array1 - The 1st array to go into the new array
        array2 - The 2nd array to go into the new array
        Returns:
        A new array containing all elements of the provided arrays

      • concat

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> T[] concat​(T[] arr0,
                             T[] arr1,
                             T[] arr2,
                             T[]... moreArrays)
        Returns a new array containing all elements of the provided arrays.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The element type of the arrays.
        Parameters:
        arr0 - The 1st array to go into the new array
        arr1 - The 2nd array to go into the new array
        arr2 - The 3rd array to go into the new array
        moreArrays - More arrays to concatenate
        Returns:
        A new array containing all elements of the provided arrays

      • contains

        public static boolean contains​(int[] array,
                               int value)
        Returns true if the provided array contains the specfied value, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to search
        value - The value to search for
        Returns:
        Whether or not the array contans the value

      • fromTemplate

        public static <T> T[] fromTemplate​(T[] template)
        Returns a new, empty array with the same element type and length as the provided array's element type and length.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the elements in the requested array
        Parameters:
        template - An array with the same length and element type as the requested array

      • fromTemplate

        public static <T> T[] fromTemplate​(T[] template,
                                   int length)
        Returns a new, empty array with the same element type as the provided array's element type. The length of the returned array is specified through the length parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the elements in the requested array
        Parameters:
        template - An array with the same element type as the requested array
        length - The desired length of the new array
        Returns:
        A new array with the same length and element type as the provided array

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf​(int[] array,
                          int value)
        Returns the array index of the first occurrence of value within the provided array. Returns -1 if the array does not contain the value.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to search
        value - The value to search for
        Returns:
        The array index of the value

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf​(Object[] array,
                          Object value)
        Returns the array index of the first occurrence of value within the provided array. Returns -1 if the array does not contain the value.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to search
        value - The value to search for
        Returns:
        The array index of the value

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty​(Object array)
        Whether or not the provided array is null or has a zero length. The array argument is of type Object so we don't need to overload for primitive and non-primitive arrays. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided object is not in fact an array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to check
        Returns:
        Whether it is null or empty
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided object is not an array.

      • isNotEmpty

        public static boolean isNotEmpty​(Object array)
        Whether or not the provided array is neither null nor has a zero length. The array argument is of type Object so we don't need to overload for primitive and non-primitive arrays. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided object is not in fact an array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to check
        Returns:
        Whether or not the provided array is neither null nor has a zero length
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided object is not an array.

      • pack

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> T[] pack​(T... objs)
        Returns the provided array. Syntactic sugar avoiding code bloat. 

         String words0 = new String[] {"Hello", "world"};
 String words1 = pack("Hello", "world");
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the objects to pack
        Parameters:
        objs - The objects to pack
        Returns:
        The packed objects

      • prefix

        public static <T> T[] prefix​(T[] array,
                             T obj)
        Prefixes the provided object to the provided array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array elements and the object to be prefixed
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be prefixed
        obj - The object to prefix
        Returns:
        A new array containing the provided object and the elements of the provided array

      • prefix

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> T[] prefix​(T[] array,
                             T obj1,
                             T obj2,
                             T... moreObjs)
        Prefixes the provided object to the provided array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array elements and the object to be prefixed
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be prefixed
        obj1 - The 1st object to prefix
        obj2 - The 2nd object to prefix
        moreObjs - More objects to prefix
        Returns:
        A new array containing the provided objects and the elements of the provided array
